intro: Besleria vargasii, commonly known as the Vargas' flame plant, is a tropical flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that resemble flames. The plant features thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in its natural habitat. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes collected for horticultural purposes, raising concerns about its conservation status in the wild.
